We are pleased to announce the release of MicrobiomeDB 12

New data in this release

  • The Human Cutaneous Leishmaniasis study is a case control study consisting of skin swabs from clincal cases of cutaneous leishmaniasis caused by Leishmania braziliensis, seen at a field hospital in Corte de Pedra, Bahia, Brazil.

There are no features in this release

Note: Our bimonthly database releases incorporate new data and correct old data when necessary. Changes in annotation and new experimental data may slightly alter your search results by increasing or decreasing the number of hits. When search parameters change with a new release, we invalidate (Ø) the search and ask you to rerun it. When sample IDs are updated or removed, we map the old IDs to the new ones, remove the old IDs from your Basket, and leave your Favorites page alone.

We are pleased to announce the release of MicrobiomeDB 11

New data in this release

  • The ENTiCE study includes stool, rectal swab, and GI biopsy microbiome data from 42 dogs undergoing treatment for Canine Chronic Enteropathy.
  • The CAMP study is a case control design that includes stool microbiome data from 155 dogs with confirmed enteric parasite infections, and 115 healthy dogs.
  • The Experimental Cutaneous Leishmaniasis study is a longitudinal study in which stool and skin swabs were collected from mice experimentally infected with Leishmania major.

We are pleased to announce the release of MicrobiomeDB 10

New data in this release

  • The GEMS1 case control dataset contains microbiome data from over 1000 children from The Gambia, Bangladesh, Kenya and Mali.

New features in this release

  • The entire site has been redesigned to showcase datasets, example queries and data visualization apps.

We are pleased to announce the release of MicrobiomeDB 3

No New data in this release

New features in this release

  • The alpha diversity app has been updated to better handle longitudinal data. A linear model fit is applied to the data, allowing users to compare alpha divesity trends over time between two covariates.
  • The beta diversity app has been modified to improve the calculation and display of large numbers of samples. In addition, users can now map both point color and shape to sample details.
  • A new correlation app has been added, bringing the total number of apps in the analysis tools section to five. This 'Corr' app allows users to visualize Spearman's correlation and statistics between taxa and categorical variables, or between the categorical variables themselves.
